translation: As you know, Leonardo da Vinci was a great painter.
transcript: 达芬奇你们都知道这是个很伟大的画家。

translation: However, he was also a splendid anatomist.
transcript: 他也是很伟大的解剖学家。

translation: On one occasion, after dissecting 30 corpses, he thought he knew everything about anatomy, including bones, bloods, and nerves.
transcript: 那么他有一次呢亲自解剖了三十具尸体，他认为都解剖清楚了，他的骨骼、他的血液、他的神经。

translation: Nevertheless, as he contemplated human body in the smallest details sitting in the morgue, this curious anatomist could not help wondering: “is there anything else about anatomy unknown to me?”
transcript: 呃最后呢他坐在那个停尸房里想，我还有什么没有解剖清楚的？

translation: As a result, two questions struck him: where is soul? and where is beauty?
transcript: 后来他自己回答自己，灵魂在哪里？美在哪里？

translation: This is because both beauty and soul cannot be savored through dissection.
transcript: 因为灵魂和美都是不可解剖的。

translation: I believe the only way for me to taste the wonders of love is to see it as a composer.
transcript: 我想我只能用一个作曲家的身份，是怎么走进这个爱这个道，来来讲述我的这个一个体验，啊。

translation: The Butterfly Lovers,which is very familiar to us, was created 53 years ago in 1959.
transcript: 你们大家都知道梁祝是嗯我们在1959年，也就是五十三年前创作的一首曲子。

translation: The story of The Butterfly Lovers,  or the household legend of Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai, has been on the lips of Chinese folks for more than 1600 years.
transcript: 那么梁祝这个故事呢，就是1600年以上流行在我们民间的一个民间传说，这是一个家喻户晓的一个民间传说。

translation: We are all acquainted with these two tragic lovers.
transcript: 啊这个里面呢呃梁山伯和祝英台的经历你们大家都知道。

translation: As I can remember, in 2002 or maybe 2004, Cui Yongyuan of CCTV was hosting a popular talk show named “Talk with Xiao Cui”.And I joined him once.
transcript: 但是在我记得在零二年还是零四年，这个中央台的小崔崔永元做过一个节目，我去了。《小崔说事》。

translation: On that episode, the culture secretaries of Ningbo, Yixing, and Jining were invited to the programme.
transcript: 这个节目的内容就是请了三个地方的文化局长，一个是宁波的，一个是宜兴的，一个是济宁的。

translation: This is because the locals of these three places all claimed their city was the hometown of Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai. Among these three places,
transcript: 因为这三个地方都说梁祝是出自他们那个地方。

translation: Jining surprises me the most for it is in Shandong.
transcript: 特别你们没想到的是济宁是山东的。

translation: During the programme, Cui Yongyuan asked them: “could you tell me which place really gave birth to the story of The Butterfly Lovers?”
transcript: 然后这三个人呢坐就坐在那儿，这个小崔就问，你们到底在哪一家梁祝诞生的？

translation: Of the three people who tried their best to justify themselves, the culture secretary of Ningbo gave the most abundant evidence.
transcript: 然后每一家都这个论证了很多道理，啊这个宁波的道理最多啦。

translation: He claimed that both the tomb and temple of Liang Shanbo had been found in Ningbo and Liang Shanbo was believed to have served in Ningbo as a petty official and an upright one.
transcript: 有梁山伯的坟，有梁山梁山伯的庙，还有呢他们考证出来梁山伯当年曾经在宁波当过小官，而且是是个清官。

translation: Well, I have been to Jining a while back, and I learned that a monument commemorating Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai was unearthed there.
transcript: 哈哈，嗯，那么济宁，我不久之前才去的，它这出土了一个梁祝的碑。

translation: The monument was authentic, as was the one excavated in Yixing.
transcript: 有那是真的，宜兴也有。

translation: Finally, the State Council identified six places from four provinces across China as the birthplace of the story of “The Butterfly Lovers”.
transcript: 所以最后国务院鉴定下来，全中国有四省六地是梁祝故事的出生地。

translation: My purpose of narrating this story is to represent an idea that the birthplace of “The Butterfly Lovers” can be in Jining, Ningbo, and Yixing for it is not just a story and it belongs to China and even the world.
transcript: 我讲这个故事就说明一个什么，我们心目中的梁祝，啊不仅仅是一个故事，啊梁祝可以在济宁，也可以在呃宁波，也可以在宜兴，但是梁祝是全中国的，啊它已经到全世界。

translation: And I told the culture secretary of Ningbo that even if Liang Shanbo was truly an upright official, people will not buy into this fact, because they prefer he was a poor scholar.
transcript: 而且梁祝我同宁波的文化局长讲，即使他是个清官，老百姓也不会认可他，他们宁可希望是一个穷秀才。

translation: This is how Chinese people think of the story of these two tragic lovers in their hearts.
transcript: 啊，所以这个是我们被全中国人民认可的一个心目中间的梁祝。

translation: This tragic yet profound story signifies the relentless pursuit of love and courageous fight against evils by these two lovers.
transcript: 而作为这个梁祝故事后面的道是什么呢？就是他们对爱的不朽的哈那种执着的追求和对恶势力的反抗。

translation: In the end of this legendary story, they proved their love and spirit by transforming into butterflies.
transcript: 而这一点在梁祝的传说里面，集中地表现在化蝶里面。

translation: Meng bo, the then deputy President and party secretary, once said, "Why not make reference to their transforming into butterflies? The transformation makes their resistance even more romantic."
transcript: 当时我们的副院长党委书记孟波先生，他就讲为什么不化蝶呢？化蝶是更浪漫的反抗。

translation: Therefore, as we composed this concerto, instead of narrating a tragic story like Romeo and Juliet's death, we added the section "lovers transforming into butterflies" into the concerto.
transcript: 所以当时我们跨过了这个讲故事的框框，啊也跨过罗密欧朱丽叶这样的殉情的结束，写了化蝶。

translation: Only afterwards did we realize that "transforming into butterflies" was the true essence of “The Butterfly Lovers”, deftly symbolizing Chinese people's feverish pursuit of love.
transcript: 写完了以后我们发觉，化蝶才是梁祝的精神，啊才是梁祝所表现的中国人对爱情的那种道，那种追求。

translation: Now, let me play the section of "transforming into butterflies" to all of you.
transcript: 那么现在我就弹一段化蝶给大家听。

translation: This melody is my interpretation of the spirit of this epic story.
transcript: 我想这个就是我对梁祝的所有的解释，都在音乐中间，啊。

translation: As I have mentioned earlier, love, together with music, art, soul and beauty, is beyond our ability to analyze or interpret.
transcript: 所所以就是我刚才讲的，爱情同音乐还有同艺术，同灵魂同美一样，都是不可分析、不可解释的。

translation: It is universal but cannot be fathomed.
transcript: 都是道可道非常道，不可道之大道也。

translation: On this account, love is something we can only pursue or experience but cannot analyze.
transcript: 所以我们对于爱只能够靠拢它，可以感受它，但是我们很难分析它。

translation: Hence, it is difficult for me to understand why the philosophy of love of today's young people hinges on how tall her/her lover is, and whether she/he has a big house or a large amount of assets.
transcript: 所以我很难理解现在我们的很多年轻人，他们有个爱情的计划表，我的对象身高多少，有没有房子，有没有财产。

translation: After the great reform and opening up, many believe that the legend of Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai is irrational.
transcript: 这个改革开放以后啊，很多人认为梁祝这个传说是不合理的。

translation: Liang Shanbo is such a smart scholar and Zhu Yingtai such a beautiful girl.
transcript: 啊，你想梁山伯那么聪明一个秀才，旁边那么漂亮个女孩子。

translation: How could he not recognize she was a girl after three years together.
transcript: 怎么会三年不知道她是女孩子呢。

translation: This is definitely irrational, let alone "transforming into butterflies".
transcript: 就显然不合理的，对吧，化蝶是更不合理的。

translation: At that time, some wiseacres even proposed to replace the traditional story of “The Butterfly Lovers” with a new one featuring a smarter Liang Shanbo who fell in love with Zhu Yingtai at first sight.
transcript: 所以呢那个时候就有些聪明人啊，要把梁山伯祝英台改成个新梁祝，改成个聪明的梁山伯，他看到祝英台一见钟情，热烈拥抱。

translation: Nevertheless, all most all audiences did not like this smarter version of Liang Shanbo.
transcript: 很奇怪，所有的观众他不认可这个聪明的梁山伯。

translation: On the contrary, they preferred the nerdy one.
transcript: 他宁可要这个傻里傻气的。

translation: Why?
transcript: 啊这为什么？

translation: There is an aesthetic question.
transcript: 这个里面是有一个美学的问题。

translation: This legend, though irrational, would not be appealing to us if it became rational.
transcript: 梁祝的传说是不合理的，但是变成合理的以后呢，就不合情了。

translation: Based on the modern criteria of dating, Zhu Yingtai would marry Ma Wencai and Liang Shanbo would never have a chance.
transcript: 现在我们这个年轻人找对象，这个祝英台绝对不会嫁给梁山伯，一定嫁给马文才，哈哈。

translation: In this legend, Liang Shanbo is an impoverished scholar.
transcript: 这个，呃这个传说里面梁山伯又是一个穷秀才。

translation: However, it is the very romance between a poor man like Liang Shanbo and a beautiful woman like Zhu Yingtai that we need the most.
transcript: 但是越是在这个时候越需要梁山伯，越需要祝英台，越说明我们内心的深处有一个很高的美学的追求。

translation: This could testify to the noble, pure and enduring aesthetic wish deeply embedded in our hearts to pursue love and beauty.
transcript: 是吧，追求那种很纯真的，这个那种执着的爱。

translation: So I believe this also represents a noble mindset.
transcript: 所以我想这个也是一种很高的一个境界。

translation: I suppose love is a legend and a sort of creativity.
transcript: 所以我想着爱情呢，它是一种传说，也是一种创造。

translation: The world is in need of constant creativity, so is love.
transcript: 因为我们生活的每一天它都在不断地创造，爱情也是需要不断地创造不断地创造。

translation: You may have noticed that Picasso, the great painter, whose last wife was 35 years younger than him.
transcript: 你注意没有Picasso，那么伟大的画家，他最后的那个妻子是比他小35岁。

translation: Charlie Chaplin, the great comic actor, was also 35 years older than Oona, his last wife.
transcript: 卓别林，伟大的戏剧家，他最后的妻子叫乌娜，也比他小35岁。

translation: Were the preference of a young pretty wife and the fickle affection of human nature the reason for a happily ever after?
transcript: 难道他们仅仅是因为喜新厌旧、年轻漂亮，啊最后他们很圆满地结合在一起啦？

translation: I've had my doubts.
transcript: 我说我曾经这样怀疑过。

translation: But I can now conclude that my doubts were wrong and I want to present an important idea that young wives can indeed accompany these ideological leaders going forward in the realm of art.
transcript: 但是我否定啦，我觉得最重要的一点，就是艺术家他们他的思想永远在往前面走的，而那个年轻的妻子可以跟他同步地前进。

translation: Of course, choosing to be an old married couple also has its saving graces.
transcript: 当然老夫老妻也很好啊，那个那个老夫老妻她会说。

translation: For example, your wife might kindheartedly remind you to add some clothes when it gets cold or eat more food when you are hungry.
transcript: 你今天凉了加一件衣服啊，或者说回头饿了加一个饭啊。

translation: This is indeed warm and sweet, but how could she possibly manage to know you are growing and evolving in your heart as an artist.
transcript: 很好，但是她可能不知道这个艺术家在怎么发展，是吧。

translation: On this ground, I assume that love is an eternal process of creation.
transcript: 所以我想真正的爱情，应该是永远创造的。

translation: Your lover is a never ending book which you have to read incessantly in an endless attempt to catch up with his mindset.
transcript: 你所爱的人永远是一本读不完的一本活页的书，她啊她也不断地增加，不断地更新，这样才可以。

translation: Next, I will introduce two songs to you, one called Beside The Suzhou River and the another Everlasting Smile, all composed by my father, Chen Gexin.
transcript: 下面呢我要介绍两首歌，一首叫《苏州河边》，还有一首是《永远的微笑》，都是我父亲陈歌辛写的。

translation: You may not be acquainted with Chen Gexin, but you must have heard of Rose, Rose, I Love You, Shanghai Nights, Gong Xi Gong Xi, and Beside The Suzhou River.
transcript: 你们可能不知道陈歌辛是谁，但是你们一定知道《玫瑰玫瑰我爱你》，一定知道《夜上海》，一定知道《恭喜恭喜》，一定知道《苏州河边》。

translation: All these wonderful songs were composed by him.
transcript: 啊，都是他写的。

translation: In my opinion, these are two songs about love.
transcript: 那么我想这个两个都是很好的表现爱情的歌。

translation: Beside The Suzhou River describes the story of two lovers walking alongside the Suzhou River.
transcript: 《苏州河边》是一对情人啊，在苏州河边走的时候。

translation: The first singer to sing the song was Yao Li who is now 91 and still lives in Hong Kong.
transcript: 那个第一个唱的叫姚莉，姚莉阿姨现在还在香港，91岁。

translation: She often recalls the time when working with my father. After finishing recording songs in the recording factory, they would take a walk on the banks of the Suzhou River.
transcript: 她常常回忆这段故事，她说那个时候她同我爸爸两人在唱片场录好音出来以后，就在苏州河边走。

translation: As depicted in the song, "Watch you look at me as I look at you; thousands of words are expressed in silence".
transcript: 就像歌词里面讲的，你望着我我望着你，千言万语变作沉默。

translation: How romantic is that!
transcript: 要多美的一个意境啊。

translation: Though undeclared, the affection to each other is deftly sprinkled within this romantic song.
transcript: 那个时候都没说出来的爱啊，就千你望着我望着你，千言万语化作沉默，这是一首情歌。

translation: The another one, Everlasting Smile, was a love song my father wrote for my mother.
transcript: 另外一首《永远的微笑》，是我父亲写给我母亲的一首情歌。

translation: As the song goes, "oh, my sweetheart, how beautiful you smiling face is…."
transcript: 啊叫心上的人儿，有笑的脸脸庞。

translation: My father said my mother looked like Mona Lisa blessed with an everlasting smile.
transcript: 他说我妈妈长得像蒙娜丽莎，啊有永远的微笑啊。

translation: As the written in the song, "The everlasting smile makes me feel like in spring while in autumn and gives me sunlight while in darkness."
transcript: 她能在深秋给我春光，她能在啊黑夜呃给我太阳。

translation: The middle of the poem reads "I cannot lose the only spring and sun I have." This, to some extent, looks likes a prophecy of tragedy.
transcript: 然后他中间一段呢好像是一个悲剧的预言，说我不能够失去我仅有的春光，我也不能失去我仅有的太阳。

translation: Unfortunately, in 1957, my father was labeled as one of the alleged "rightists" and was therefore forced to leave home and died shortly afterwards.
transcript: 因为后来我父亲很不幸地在五七年被打成右派，他离开了家里，很早就去世了。

translation: This is how the prophecy came true.
transcript: 然后他就预言了他这个悲剧的命运。

translation: The last two lines of the song are " My sweet heart, do not be filled with sorrow. May you live happily with an everlasting smile".
transcript: 然后最后两句歌词，心上的人儿，你不要悲伤，愿你的笑容永远那样。

translation: After losing her husband when she was 46, she has been singing this song while raising 4 kids until her death in the year before last.
transcript: 后来我母亲在46岁的父亲去世了以后，她就带着四个孩子唱着这首歌，一直到前年她离开了这个世界。

translation: I know this song will forever accompany her in the afterlife.
transcript: 啊，这首歌永远地陪伴着她。

translation: I think their relationship and sentiment toward each other resemble the love between Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai.
transcript: 我觉得他们这种很崇高的那种深情那种真情，啊就是梁山伯祝英台式的爱情。

translation: Now, let me introduce my good friend, Miss Wang Weiqian, the chief mezzo-soprano of the Shanghai Opera House.
transcript: 那么下面呢，我请出我的好朋友，那个上海歌剧院的首席女中音啊王维倩小姐，现在请王维倩。

translation: Let's take a walk beside the Suzhou River in the beautiful melody composed by Chen Gexin!
transcript: 让我们在陈歌辛先生所谱写的优美旋律中，大家和我一起到苏州河边去走一走。

translation: As Mr Chen has said, after a walk in silence with the singer Yao Li, Chen Gexin, the splendid composer, created this excellent song that has been passed down to today within a few minutes after he returned home.
transcript: 歌曲的灵感呢就如陈老师所说，是歌仙陈歌辛先生和歌手姚莉女士在苏州河边默默无语地散步，回家后的几分钟，歌仙就写出了这首传世佳作。

translation: It is also the catchiest oriental serenade I have ever heard.
transcript: 迄今为止呢，也是我所听到的最为优美的一首东方小夜曲。

translation: We also call it "Profound Serenade."
transcript: 我们称之为“深沉小夜曲”。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢！

translation: Accompanied by Mr Chen, we will present these two romantic songs to all of you.
transcript: 下面呢呃陈老师呢将为我伴奏，我们把这首他们父母两个人的情歌献给大家。
